description: Clockwise is a rapid-fire discussion of current technology issues hosted by Dan Moren and Mikah Sargent and featuring two special guests each week. Four people, four topics--and because we're always watching the clock, no episode is longer than 30 minutes. Hosted by Dan Moren and Mikah Sargent.
title: Clockwise

episodes.title: 372: Comparing Apples to Intels
episodes.description: The tasks we still do analog instead of digital, the lack of touch interfaces on Apple's new Macs, is this the end of speeds and feeds, and whether we can live with just two ports on our computers.

episodes.title: 371: I Don't Need to Lidar a Squirrel
episodes.description: What has us excited about Apple Silicon Macs, the iPhones we're currently using, our smartphone photography habits, and the tech we want but know we'll never use.

episodes.title: 370: We All Deserve a Break
episodes.description: Our search engine habits and whether we'd change them, our thoughts and fears re: autonomous driving, rumors of reverse charging on iPhone 12, and how we feel about Facebook logins for Oculus.

episodes.title: 369: It's the Tip of the Iceberg, but the Iceberg is Also On Fire
episodes.description: Google in the government's antitrust crosshairs, politicians streaming video games, our cloud storage habits, and what the heck is going on with 5G.

episodes.title: 368: Not Your Grandparents' MagSafe
episodes.description: What Apple didn't announce this week, whether the smartphone is ready to be our only computer, the portless iPhone of the future, and how we decide which iPhone to buy.

episodes.title: 367: Sitting Here Like a Sucker
episodes.description: Apple event expectations, paying for cable even when we're not, early tech adoption, and the home gear we wish were smarter.

episodes.title: 366: There's a Microphone in My Mouth
episodes.description: Amazon's Ring's Always Home Cam drone, how the pandemic has affected our social media habits, our thoughts on online services outages, and a technology retrospective.

episodes.title: 365: Skeuomorphism is Never Dead
episodes.description: Homescreen customization, favorite iOS 14 features and bugs, the devices on which we work, and vintage tech we coveted.

episodes.title: 364: The MacBook Pro Is Technically Foldable
episodes.description:
• Does the Apple Watch update justify the new number?
• What will Apple do with the iPad Pro now that the iPad Air has been upgraded?
• Does the Apple Watch SE hit the "sweet spot" and price and functionality?
• Was Apple right to remove the Apple Watch charging brick? Will it do the same for the iPhone 12?

episodes.title: 363: No Guinea Pig Applications
episodes.description: Apple event hopes, finding joy, our NFC uses, and how virtual conferences have changed things for the better.

episodes.title: 362: My Default Mode Is Skepticism
episodes.description: What's your online fact-finding process? Is the pandemic causing our social skills to atrophy? What Apple rumors have you most — and least — excited? If you could use a high-performance virtual workstation offsite, would you? Shelly Brisbin and Joseph Rosensteel join us to answer these questions and more!

episodes.title: 361: Fires, Earthquakes, and Plague Zombies
episodes.description: Our recent tech-related pandemic purchases, videoconferencing likes and wishes, coolest dream tech, and emergency preparedness packs.

episodes.title: 360: Your Laughter Is a Spoiler
episodes.description: Are you a tech hypocrite? What's a social media feature you want on other social networks? Do you listen to the radio? What do you think of Dropbox's new features? Kathy Campbell, Dan Sturm, and Jason Snell join Mikah Sargent to answer these questions!

episodes.title: 359: Confused and Full of Starch
episodes.description: Microsoft and Apple argue about cloud gaming, the iOS apps we want to run on our Macs, the future—or lack thereof—of foldable phones, and whether we'd trade our Face ID in for Touch ID.

episodes.title: 358: What's It Called? The Yellow One
episodes.description: Can Instagram Reels take on TikTok? What are our favorite low-tech pastimes? What do we think of Disney's Mulan release? What promised future tech did we think we'd have by now? Aleen Simms and Jeremy Burge join us to answer these questions!

episodes.title: 357: Not Yet and Also Never
episodes.description: Streaming services' Watch Together features, how concerned we are about Big Tech personally, what we buy from online ads, and the riskiest tech in our homes, privacy wise.

episodes.title: 356: A Solid “Sometimes”
episodes.description: Watching video podcasts, our favorite health-related apps, unnecessarily complicated tech processes, and cheap tech gear that ended up being fun to use.

episodes.title: 355: Let's Kill Quibi!
episodes.description: The era of peak streaming services, Apple's blindspots, our work device setups, and the iPhone tips that surprise and delight people.

episodes.title: 354: I Needed to Flee Reality
episodes.description: How staying home has impacted our use of social media, the tech we've ordered since the start of the pandemic, the subscription service we'd recommend to others, and low-tech solutions to high tech problems.

episodes.title: 353: Shortcut Concierge
episodes.description: Our strategy for adopting Apple software betas, the future of gaming on Apple silicon, when we'll buy an Apple silicon Mac, and what we'd like to automate for social good.

episodes.title: 352: Garbage: Folder. Problems: Kettle.
episodes.description: How iOS 14's App Library will change our app organization habits, our thoughts on Mac Catalyst in the age of ARM Macs, how we feel about the macOS redesign, and WWDC's new format.

episodes.title: 351: Sacrificing an Apple Pencil to the Fire
episodes.description: Pie-in-the-sky WWDC predictions, Apple's latest App Store kerfuffle, streaming video games online, and the future of AR in light of Bose's withdrawal from the market.

episodes.title: 350: A Hunk of Inert Matter
episodes.description: Whether we'd trade up for a new Mac, what we'd track using our iPhones, our excitements and concerns over the Mac ARM transition, and how we're handling tragedy and normaly on social media.

episodes.title: 349: That Was Chef's Kiss for Me
episodes.description: Our use of voice assistants on our phones, mass deleting content from social media, the tech we use to wake up, and companies responding to current events.

episodes.title: 348: Save Me From My Shame
episodes.description: Tech that helps us sleep, our thoughts on HBO Max, how we'd fix social media if we were in charge, and our plans (or lack thereof) to visit reopening Apple stores.

episodes.title: 347: The Low Tech Way is The Easiest Way
episodes.description: Apple may not be including headphones with the next iPhone, the restaurants and other places we want to visit when the quarantine is over, our latest online gaming experiences, and how we watch movies with friends over the Internet.

episodes.title: 346: Beyoncé in Space!
episodes.description:
What's something you're itching to learn? What would be the topic(s) of your own virtual conference? What's your essential quarantine tech? Which star would you send to space?

Lory Gil and Zac Hall are here to answer these questions and more!

episodes.title: 345: Bluetooth Kiss
episodes.description: Pandemic tech changes we'd like, privacy concerns over contact tracing, the best (and worst) phishing attempts, and Twitter chastises language.

episodes.title: 344: Surrounded by Chocolate and Distractions
episodes.description:
What's the last video or piece of media that impacted you? What if everyone unmuted their mics in video meetings? What's your typical work setup these days? What tech is getting you through the week?

Megan Morrone and James Thomson are here to answer these questions and more!

episodes.title: 343: Allow Me to Interpret Gibberish
episodes.description: The tech our current world situation has made us appreciate (or realize we don't need), what age is too young for tech, voice assistant misfires, and our favorite virtual backgrounds on video chat.

episodes.title: 342: I, Too, Am Concerned About My Isolation Beard
episodes.description: How do we organize our smartphone home screens? What are some ways companies are pivoting in the wake of COVID-19? How have our tech purchasing habits been impacted by COVID-19? Have the "shelter in place" orders affected our tech use? Kathy Campbell and Jeremy Burge join Dan Moren and Mikah Sargent to answer these questions!

episodes.title: 341: The Fiddliest of Fiddly Fiddlers
episodes.description: Our remote tech troubleshooting tips, the most and least fiddly tech, how the open web benefited our learning, and whether Quibi is genius or madness.

episodes.title: 340: How Often Do I Have to Wash My Hair?
episodes.description: Can Fitbit's new wearable take on the Apple Watch? How do you balance privacy, security, and reaching out to family during COVID-19? Can you use an iPad as your primary device? Should macOS support touch interaction? Answers to all these questions can be found within!

episodes.title: 339: Hide and Don't Go Seek
episodes.description: How we deal with old tech and data, what we do to entertain ourselves (and friends) via Zoom and Skype, our health tracking habits, and the weirdest COVID-19 related emails we've gotten from companies.

episodes.title: 338: Am I Allowed to Say Whisk(e)y?
episodes.description: How technology has helped us with social distancing, how we're coping with media anxiety, our tips for working — and living — from home, and COVID-19's effect on future infrastructure.

episodes.title: 337: Blue Bubble Betterment
episodes.description: The rumored iOS 14 features we're most anticipating, what we'd like to see on the next Apple Watch, our digital (and analogue) journaling habits, and how we handle calendaring, notes, and to-dos.

episodes.title: 336: The Best Kind of Answer: Yes & No
episodes.description: Whether we've used app-connected scooters and bikes, how podcasts have changed our music-listening habits, how the coronavirus is impacting tech events, tradeshows, and this year's phone updates.

episodes.title: 335: Some Sort of Dongleage
episodes.description: The debate over standardizing smartphone charging ports, how we feel about HomeKit Secure Video, whether we want an autonomous car, and what kind of Instagram users we are.

episodes.title: 334: I Like That We Live in the Future
episodes.description: Apps and services we use to communicate, complaints about Google's mobile productivity suite, our antivirus practices, and mobile games we've kept around for awhile.

episodes.title: 333: Throwing the Spaghetti at the Consumer
episodes.description: Samsung's latest flip phone, security tips for elections and ordinary people, high refresh rate phones, and the challenge online learning brings to traditional universities.

episodes.title: 332: One Hip Lies
episodes.description: The best and worst of Apple in the year gone by, Google's divisive Super Bowl ad, how we'd fix Apple News+, and what the iPad is still missing.

episodes.title: 331: Ambulatory Meat Sack
episodes.description: Our app preferences on macOS and iOS, if we're TikTok'in', our sleep-tracking habits (or lack thereof), and the last tech tip we shared that blew someone's mind.

episodes.title: 330: I Call That the Airplane Squirrel
episodes.description: Digital wellbeing apps and features, movies and TV shows we thought would accurately predict the future, our encryption habits, and our "analog" hobbies. Plus, our first jobs!

episodes.title: 329: Forgetting as a Service
episodes.description: Our best security practices, the services we'd still like to see from tech companies, thoughts on Twitter's experimental reply system, and the last apps we fell in love with.

episodes.title: 328: Kicking off 2020 for the Second Time
episodes.description: The coolest or weirdest things we've seen from CES, podcasts we want made into books, whether we're still downloading new mobile apps, and our experiences with guided meditation and Apple's Breathe app.

episodes.title: 327: Chiming in the New Year
episodes.description:
The tech we:

* want to see in 2020
* felt made the most difference in our life in 2019
* gifted this holiday season
* did or did not use in 2000 that we do or do not use today

episodes.title: 326: Why We Find Solace In Love
episodes.description: Our tech stocking stuffers, why the Mac's community exists, Apple's satellite interests, and a port-less—but modular?—iPhone.

episodes.title: 325: Roomba vs. Baby
episodes.description: Sprucing up the holidays with gadgets, our tech New Year's resolutions, one new smart home standard to rule them all, and our excitement (or lack thereof) for new generations of game consoles.

episodes.title: 324: Vehicles of Contamination
episodes.description: Cleaning our tech, staying in touch while traveling, the next step for the consumer Mac lineup, and our thoughts on Apple rumors and how they're covered.

episodes.title: 323: Everything in My Computing Life is Chaos
episodes.description: Best tech gifts given and received, the future of the HomePod, how we deal with all our photos, and unplugging while on vacation.

episodes.title: 322: I'm More Surprised That I Was Surprised
episodes.description: We aren't surprised the California DMV is selling personal data, we share our thoughts on video-recording-and-sharing-service Loom, Dan buys (at a discount) all our Thanksgiving & Black Friday deals tips, and we discuss "sharenting."

episodes.title: 321: Stick an Apple on It
episodes.description: How we store our data and notes, the impact of Apple's new Austin campus, our exposure to TikTok, and thoughts on Google Stadia's launch.

episodes.title: 320: Why Not Both?
episodes.description: Tech innovations we've come to appreciate, our thoughts on 5G, how Apple decided to improve its MacBook keyboard, and our latest internet rabbit holes.

episodes.title: 319: I Find Comfort in Managing Assets
episodes.description: Nerdy technical tasks, our upgrade decisions in a post-Catalina world, thoughts on Photoshop for iPad, and how we deal with new software features.

episodes.title: 318: AirPods Sucking as a Service (ASaaS)
episodes.description: Our task management workflows, the moment we knew — as kids — that we were incredibly interested in technology, our thoughts on AirPods Pro, and how we assist relatives with their technology needs.

episodes.title: 317: Fancy Super Duper Techno Chippy Things
episodes.description: Applications for Apple's rumored AR glasses, our feelings on technology companies in bed with autocratic governments, wired vs. wireless headphones, and Instagram's banning of cosmetic surgery filters.

episodes.title: 316: Vaguely Hippie Leanings
episodes.description: Taking a look at the way tech affects privacy and ethics, whether we think this is Siri's year to shine, our thoughts on the Pixel 4 gesture system, and the first thing we'd do if we ran Facebook.

episodes.title: 315: Pop Quiz, Hot Shot!
episodes.description: Jumping to macOS Catalina (or not), the software and hardware we'd most and least like to lose, Windows on good hardware vs. macOS on crappy hardware, and legal requirements for accessibility on the web.

episodes.title: 314: Get a Real Computer, Jerk
episodes.description: Amazon's cavalcade of new Alexa devices, ultrawide vs. telephoto lenses on smartphones, what one device we'd take to college, and our travel tips.

episodes.title: 313: These Deals are Just Too Fresh
episodes.description: Our cloud storage solutions, why Apple News+ is pricier than TV+ and Arcade, what social networks we're using these days, and our strategies for unplugging from the endless barrage of information.

episodes.title: 312: Nerdy, Technolust Folks
episodes.description: Our favorite smartphone photos, our thoughts on selfies, what we still want from the Apple Watch, and whether we think Night Mode on the new iPhones is a gimmick or a great new feature.

episodes.title: 311: A Ten Buck Case on a Thousand Dollar Phone
episodes.description: Diminishing returns in smartphone updates, our feelings on Apple Arcade, whether iPhone colors are important to us, and the features that we are (and aren't) looking forward to in macOS Catalina.

episodes.title: 310: I Don’t Know Why This Is Dungeon Themed
episodes.description: New hardware we want Apple to announce at its upcoming event, the product or company we think should take advantage of TikTok marketing, iOS & macOS features we could do without, and sleep tracking with wearables.

episodes.title: 309: An Unnecessary Drive Someplace
episodes.description: Tech products we want that no one makes, the best phone for "civilians," apps that we've recently downloaded, and which companies we think Apple should buy.

episodes.title: 308: Lipstick on a Piggy Bank
episodes.description: Our methods for getting things done, a follow-up on Qi charging, whether we think the Apple Card is truly different, and our subscription service reckoning.

episodes.title: 307: I'm Seeing a Bunch of Bananas
episodes.description: Our credit card strategies, the books we want to be made into television series, using online delivery services, and our commitment to clipboard managers.

episodes.title: 306: A Drone-Clouded Sky
episodes.description: The future of delivery, our thoughts on crowdsourced online grave memorials, our tech placebos, and the problems we want the next round of smartphones to solve.

episodes.title: 305: The Awakeness of the Rose
episodes.description: Simple tech tips, our thoughts on Apple's latest earnings report, what pro products we'd pay premiums to own, and how we feel about humans "grading" Siri requests.

episodes.title: 304: Grime Crime
episodes.description: Fines and antitrust investigations of Big Tech: do they work? Plus, how often we clean our devices, the last time we shot video on our iPhone, and whether we listen to music while we work.

episodes.title: 303: Early Morning Grotesquerie
episodes.description: Best photo-sharing site for group events, managing multiple smartphone lenses, Apple's rumored foray into the podcasting business, and modern-day moonshots that inspire us.

episodes.title: 302: Unsettling, Weird, and Kind of Gross
episodes.description: FaceTime Attention Correction and the future of augmented reality, how we imagined future tech as kids and what's available now, our thoughts on the Nintendo Switch Lite, and a look back at the first Apple products we owned.

episodes.title: 301: My Vulcan Mind
episodes.description: Jony Ive's departure from Apple, whether we really unplug on vacation, the persistence (or lack thereof) of gamification, and outdoor tech that has our attention.

episodes.title: 300: My Journey Is Full of Magic
episodes.description: Harry Potter: Wizards Unite, our public tech embarrassments, whether we've delved into Apple's public (and developer) betas, and our tips and tricks for the multi-Mac lifestyle.

episodes.title: 299: We're All a Mess Together
episodes.description: Our file storage strategies, Facebook's new cryptocurrency, AR try-on features, and the biggest and most useful announcements from iOS 13.

episodes.title: 298: The Bloodcurdling Scream of an Alarm
episodes.description: Monitoring our hearing health, how we use technology in our morning routines, using CarPlay or Android Auto in the car, and our thoughts on Apple's App Store policies and practices.

episodes.title: 297: Lost in the Debacle
episodes.description: Favorite iOS 13 features, the birth of iPadOS, Project Catalyst apps, and pro hardware.

episodes.title: 296: Google Wave Was the Best Thing Ever
episodes.description: Apps we want to see in Dark Mode, our thoughts on the new iPod touch, whether Apple's App Store is anti-competitive, and discussions on tech cynicism.

episodes.title: 295: Pixie Dust
episodes.description: Apple's latest MacBook keyboard revamp, tech impacts of the US-China trade war, a new plan to block tracking cookies, and whether we've considered an electric vehicle.

episodes.title: 294: More Twists Than a Bag of Pretzels
episodes.description: Alexa Guard, our swag collection habits, thoughts on cities banning authorities from using facial recognition tech, and where we'll stand when mega-corporations rule the future.

episodes.title: 293: An Electric Scooter Is the New Horse
episodes.description: What caught our eyes at Google I/O, our thoughts on electric scooters and urban transport, the last time technology brought a smile to our faces, and our digital decluttering habits.

episodes.title: 292: The Drums are the Worst Part
episodes.description: How we distract ourselves with tech while traveling, our thoughts on the new Luminary podcast service, the places we find ourselves missing Apple Pay, and what we'd do with our one WWDC wish if it were granted.

episodes.title: 291: My Fingers are My Meese
episodes.description: Pointing devices on iPads, our favorite bad tech disasters, drone deliveries, and how to sell your old tech.

episodes.title: 290: Huge Honkin' Phones
episodes.description: Some ways we've seen tech used to benefit society, our thoughts on foldable phones and other form factors, improvements we hope to see in iOS 13, and what we think about the rumored macOS Sidecar.

episodes.title: 289: Down to the Level of Atoms
episodes.description: Are we downloading new apps less frequently, what features we'd like revisited in an iTunes break-up, smart health gadgets that intrigue us, and our impressions of Apple News+.

episodes.title: 288: Facebook Is Gonna Facebook
episodes.description: Mundane tasks we think voice assistants could improve, living the multi-pad lifestyle, tech movie tropes that annoy us, and our thoughts on Mark Zuckerberg's op-ed.

episodes.title: 287: The Opposite of What They're Doing
episodes.description: Subscription gaming services, what would make Apple's TV+ offering more compelling, third-party keyboards, and whether or not we will be getting the Apple Card.

episodes.title: 286: I Used to Be Boring
episodes.description: What we think of the new iPad mini, how we physically customize our devices, other products we think Apple could announce this week, and our thoughts on Apple employees appearing on podcasts.

episodes.title: 285: Hey, It's Capitalism!
episodes.description: With Apple's new services waiting in the wings, are we feeling subscription fatigue? Plus, fragmentation in the smart home market, Spotify says Apple is being anticompetitive, and have we lost our sense of wonder when it comes to technology?

episodes.title: 284: Fairy Facts and Unicorn Facts
episodes.description: Devices we've repaired ourselves, the features we'd choose for a thicker, heavier phone, our thoughts on WebAuthn and the future of passwords, and our privacy concerns for video doorbell cameras.

episodes.title: 283: How This "Unfolds"
episodes.description: Repairing our hardware, how many cameras is too many on a smartphone, the Samsung Galaxy Fold vs. the Huawei Mate X, and what we use Siri for.

episodes.title: 282: Party Popper Dealy-Bob
episodes.description: How we'd improve emoji search, times we took longer finding tools for tasks than completing the tasks themselves, vintage tech and game nostalgia, and the default app we'd redesign in iOS 13.

episodes.title: 281: Developers Need to Feed Their Pet Chickens
episodes.description: Apple may want 50 percent of publishers' revenue, where is the money from the App Store going, Amazon's acquisition of eero, and the transformative tech that pales next to where we are today.

episodes.title: 280: I Swear I’m Not a Vinyl Hipster
episodes.description: Which iOS apps and games we've kept on our devices, what features would make us use Siri and Shortcuts more, the first thing we'd change if we were in charge of Apple retail, and our predictions on the death of physical media.

episodes.title: 279: What Sorcery Is This?
episodes.description: Our usage of group FaceTime before and after Apple's bug, which tech company we'd choose to run the country, what it will take for data privacy to be taken seriously, and how we deal with information overload in this day and age.

episodes.title: 278: Marie Kondo'ing Your Notifications
episodes.description: How we consume text-based content online, the smartphone and desktop notifications we can't live without, whether foldable phones are a gimmick, and the tech we'd use to improve sporting events.

episodes.title: 277: Say Hello to Your Little Friend
episodes.description: Apple products we'd like to see revived, our favorite underdog technology, future tech we're still waiting for, and our thoughts on AirPower and Apple's new battery cases.

episodes.title: 276: That's Not a Place You Want Cameras
episodes.description: Items and rooms in our home we wish were "smart," the platform(s) we think could replace YouTube, potential services Apple could offer, and our thoughts on AirPlay 2 and iTunes coming to third-party TVs.

episodes.title: 275: So Many Guinea Pigs on Facebook
episodes.description: Most anticipated tech of 2019, our social media plans, New Year's resolutions, and the future of the iPad mini.

episodes.title: 274: I Don’t Have a Dog! I Don’t Wear Glasses!
episodes.description: Our favorite tech gifts we gave this year, Snapchat's new AR lenses for dogs, the most significant tech stories of 2018, and three ways tech made our holidays better.

episodes.title: 273: I'm in Troubletown
episodes.description: Facebook's latest privacy woes, other smartphone features we'd love to see in iOS, how our offices are decorated, and what services we use for wish lists.

episodes.title: 272: I’m Aware I’m Beyond Help
episodes.description: Predicting our self-driving car future, what folks we'd hire to complete our technical work, the headphones we use regularly, and the future of the smart home.

episodes.title: 271: I'll Be Backed Up
episodes.description: Apple Music coming to Echo devices, the celebrity spokesperson we'd like to do a tech PSA, what tech knowledge we'd like to grant people, and whether we change our iPhone cases or Apple Watch bands.

episodes.title: 270: The Clockwise Lounge
episodes.description: Our favorite tech tips, our holiday gift suggestions, the ways we've used technology to help us cook, and our streaming media plans for the new year.

episodes.title: 269: Mwah, Chef's Kiss!
episodes.description: Black Friday and Cyber Monday shopping, an update on using Apple Pay, the responsibilities of tech gift-giving, and our end-of-the-year dream product.

episodes.title: 268: Wi-Pie
episodes.description: iOS's discoverability problem, when we buy gear for ourselves, holiday tech support tasks, and using an iPad as an external display for a Mac.

episodes.title: 267: A Belligerent Platypus on Steroids
episodes.description: The future of voice tech, our goals as content creators, tech repairability, and “microchipping” humans.

episodes.title: 266: I’m in Dongle Heck
episodes.description: Tech products we'd like to see resurrected, how we deal with dongle madness, the ways technology helped or hindered our voting experience, and tech decisions we've reversed ourselves on.

episodes.title: 265: The Least-Egregious Sin
episodes.description: “Real” Photoshop on the iPad Pro, “Today at Apple” sessions, the new MacBook Air's place in Apple's lineup, and pondering the usefulness of iPad Pro for audio professionals.

episodes.title: 264: In the Parlance of Today
episodes.description: Nitpicks in tech products we love, tech gifts on the cheap, gadget regrets, and how companies and publications should address mistakes.

episodes.title: 263: Down With the System, Man!
episodes.description: Third-party voice assistants on smartphones, to-do lists and how we stay organized, our first programming experiences, and impressions of the new Palm phone for your phone.

episodes.title: 262: What If It's a Tiger?
episodes.description: USB-C adoption, Google's new hardware, whether we use walkie-talkie features, and small technologies that have changed our lives.

episodes.title: 261: One of Those Vinyl People
episodes.description: What physical media we own, how an ideal smart assistant would behave, where we hosted our first websites, and a chat about the Chromebook.

episodes.title: 260: I Don't Even Have a Suction Cup
episodes.description: Which productivity suites we use, our favorite features in macOS Mojave, what smart tech (if any) we use in our cars, and Mojave's iOS transplant apps.

episodes.title: 259: Like Android, But Prettier
episodes.description: iOS 12's most exciting features, our experiences with Workflow and Shortcuts, what HomePod features are still missing, and which iOS 12 and iPhone features we'll be explaining to our non-techy friends.

episodes.title: 258: I'm Petty and I Want My Colors
episodes.description: Dual SIM technology on the iPhone, punishments for corporations' privacy violations, colors on the iPhone XR, and the death of Apple's small phones.

episodes.title: 257: Prison Spotlight
episodes.description: Skype adds call recording, HomeKit's missing features, what we're looking for in a new smartwatch, and what one more thing might appear at next week's Apple event.

episodes.title: 256: A High Stakes Podcast
episodes.description: How often we use the command line, in what ways we've become more mindful about our tech usage, Apple's addition of AirPlay 2 to the AirPort Express, and what tech constraints have taught us about ourselves.

episodes.title: 255: Reverse Sherlocked
episodes.description: Our Do Not Disturb habits, the death of Back to My Mac, the rise of Mastodon, and what exactly a "pro" Mac mini might entail.

episodes.title: 254: Gigs and Teras of Flop Data
episodes.description: How often we shut down and restart our computers, what to do with a problem like Twitter, the fate of all those EarPods we get from Apple, and camera improvements we'd like to see in this year's iPhone.

episodes.title: 253: Creepy Beating Heart
episodes.description: Most of us use Low Power mode on iOS occasionally, but one of us doesn't. Plus, how much we would pay for a calendar app, Microsoft walking back its decision to drop old Skype, and indie games we have played.

episodes.title: 252: I'm Not Alone in My Monsterdom
episodes.description: How we organize (or don't organize) our files, whether it's time to jump into the 3D printer market, the tech accessories that impress us, and which batteries we carry around.

episodes.title: 251: That's Literally the Thing That I Want
episodes.description: How many of iMessage's bells and whistles we use, Memoji's balancing between incredible or silly, what colors we'd like to see iPhones in, and non-earbud competitors to AirPods.

episodes.title: 250: Bring Us The Dogmoji
episodes.description: Our unplugging strategies, what to do when you run out of space for physical media, whether we'd let UPS delivery people into our homes, and our favorite and most wished-for emoji.

episodes.title: 249: Six Years from Today
episodes.description: Surprisingly smart (or dumb) home gadgets, how we discover apps, what we use to print out photos and photo books, and how much of our work we do on the iPad.

episodes.title: 248: Six Filters Was All We Needed in My Day
episodes.description: Apple's Maps overhaul, Instagram's "you're caught up!" feature, e-commerce via social media, and Apple Pay for public transit.

episodes.title: 247: It's What the Kids Want
episodes.description: Instagram's new IGTV, our biggest tech blunders, the Fortnite and free-to-play craze, and smart home gadgets being used in domestic abuse cases.

episodes.title: 246: Things That Control Other Things
episodes.description: How Apple will sell its TV service, our favorite announcements from E3, using smart speakers to control smart home devices, and whether AMC's MoviePass competitor appeals.

episodes.title: 245: Guinea Pig Hate Mail
episodes.description: The WWDC announcements that delighted us, whether Memoji will stand the test of time, the Apple news that didn't happen, and the appeal of attending a conference like WWDC.

episodes.title: 244: The Smooshing of Everything
episodes.description: Live from WWDC at San Jose, California: Apple's AR ambitions, tracking your Screen Time on iOS, mobile apps on the Mac, and Siri's new Shortcuts.

episodes.title: 243: Under the Steps of a Drunken Giant
episodes.description: How we edit our photos for sharing, Snapchat's platform play, the macOS features we'd like to see at WWDC, and whether or not we still use that crazy little thing called email.

episodes.title: 242: A Sock For Everything
episodes.description: How we consume music these days, why people are grumpy about Apple, Apple's privacy download tool, and what we'd like to see across platforms at WWDC.

episodes.title: 241: I'm a Mostly Terrible Person
episodes.description: DirecTV's new cloud DVR feature, iPhone SE 2 features we'd like to see, Microsoft's iPad competitor, and how we'd like Apple to improve notifications in iOS 12.

episodes.title: 240: Just the Downfall of Humanity
episodes.description: Google's nifty/creepy AI phone calls, the iMac turns 20, Apple's security feature that disables USB on the iPhone, and the state of developer's percentage on app sales.

episodes.title: 239: Clippy Wearing a Stethoscope
episodes.description: Add-on lens solutions for smartphones, Facebook using AI to detect hate speech, how tech can improve our medical lives, and the tricky ethics of video doorbells.

episodes.title: 238: A Much Larger and Possibly Stupider World
episodes.description: Our obsessive tech hobbies and pastimes, the attraction of clicky keyboards, what SmugMug's Flickr acquisition means, and whether a faux analogue digital camera appeals to us.

episodes.title: 237: We Call Those Features
episodes.description: Our worries over Twitter's third-party API restrictions, favorite Mac menu bar apps, Apple's subscription news service, and how Facebook's new privacy controls change our feelings, if at all.

episodes.title: 236: Audible Cringe
episodes.description: Our email setups, whether we think there are viable Facebook alternatives, our feelings on Uber expanding into other forms of transportation, and will there ever be a social media platform we can trust completely?

episodes.title: 235: Scientific Cannibalism
episodes.description: Cashierless stores of the future, what we'd like to see added to HomeKit, our current ebook purchasing strategies, and the question of lab-grown meat.

episodes.title: 234: All The Great Blasphemous Shows
episodes.description: Our Facebook and Google privacy concerns, interest (or lack thereof) in the Oculus Go and VR, thoughts on the Logitech Crayon stylus announced yesterday, and whether Apple's streaming service is too late to the party.

episodes.title: 233: Betray Me as a Consumerist Fool
episodes.description: The latest Facebook privacy hoopla, Amnesty International says Twitter violates women's rights, Apple's upcoming education event, and questions about the future of self-driving car technology.

episodes.title: 232: I Already Don't Think Money is Real
episodes.description: Cryptocurrencies, tech devices we don't want to upgrade, our favorite smart gadgets, and the contentious issue of whether we use our phones in the shower.

episodes.title: 231: Digital Okies
episodes.description: Our smart and dumb home thermostats, the fractured state of net neutrality laws, the potential resurrection of the MacBook Air, and AI technology in military hands.

episodes.title: 230: An Adult With a Credit Card
episodes.description: Apple's foray into healthcare, the one thing we think Siri needs to improve, where we stream most of our content, and our feelings on the latest social network, Vero.

episodes.title: 229: Nine Different News Apps
episodes.description: Our book-reading (or listening) habits, how we use tech to get our news, Twitter's abandonment of the Mac desktop, and our feelings on fingerprint readers vs. facial recognition.

episodes.title: 228: Wrong Robot Name
episodes.description: Our essential travel tech, most romantic uses of technology, biggest technology disappointments, and thoughts about the HomePod.

episodes.title: 227: The Oprah of Apps
episodes.description: How we listen to audio, what problems we want technology to solve, whether we buy apps as gifts for other people, and if we plan on getting the HomePod.

episodes.title: 226: Where Are My Little Ears?!
episodes.description: Where we'd like to see Apple focus its software quality attentions, our feelings about the iPhone X and its sales, home theater lighting, and our favorite tech of last year.

episodes.title: 225: Every Feeling Has Been Felt Already
episodes.description: Whether drones are here to stay, how we're doing with our New Year's tech resolutions, the affect of missing features on the HomePod, and our paper vs. digital note-taking thoughts.

episodes.title: 224: Hypothetical Hoarding
episodes.description: How to deal with hoarding old tech, our biggest tech disappointments, the VR and AR experiences that have us excited, and the state of dictation and voice assistant software.

episodes.title: 223: Self-Driving Toilet
episodes.description: Smart toilets: brilliant or ridiculous? Plus, the state of Twitter, what to watch for at CES 2018, and whether cryptocurrencies are here to stay.

episodes.title: 222: Big Banana Fingers
episodes.description: Changes we'd like to see Apple make in 2018, our best personal tech stories from the holidays, our most delightful apps and games of 2017, and how best to run Windows on your Mac.

episodes.title: 221: I'm Calling HR
episodes.description: Our favorite (or most challenging) tech support jobs of the holidays or year, the tech items we wish we'd gotten as gifts, the biggest tech blunders of 2017, and our wishlists for tech for 2018.

episodes.title: 220: What Is Wrong With Everyone?
episodes.description: Apple's possibly unified app platform, the Essential Phone and "iPhone killers," activity and health tracking, and have iOS's Settings gotten too complicated?

episodes.title: 219: Access to Tim Cook's Checkbook
episodes.description: A wireless charging retrospective, companies or technologies Apple should invest in, the future of the desktop computer, and the potential of AR in education.

episodes.title: 218: The World is Our Oyster
episodes.description: Apple Pay Cash experiences, Google and Amazon's YouTube tiff, increasingly complex emoji, and what we'll think of the iPhone in another ten years.

episodes.title: 217: I Live in a Robot Shop of Horrors
episodes.description: Robots we'd invite into our houses, Nintendo's approach to mobile gaming, gestured-based computing, and what's the responsibility for reporting critical software vulnerabilities.

episodes.title: 216: Patience and Bourbon
episodes.description: Holiday tech support tips, kitchen smart gadgets, what we do with our photos, and whether we could get by with a simple phone.

episodes.title: 215: Exactly What A Spy Would Say
episodes.description: Face ID spoofing, Facebook wants your nude pictures, whether we'd leave Twitter, and what we'd like to see Apple change for the iPhone X.

episodes.title: 214: The Table is Totally Irrelevant
episodes.description: Online payment services and Apple Pay Cash, tech workarounds we love, whether wearables will work, and AR's killer apps—or lack thereof.

episodes.title: 213: Case by Case Basis
episodes.description: Animoji: passing fad or important new technology? Also, whether or not we use a case on our smartphones, how Face ID's one-face limit affects us (if at all), and why iPhone users and Android users seem to clash so much.

episodes.title: 212: The Leaks are Coming From Inside the House
episodes.description: Would you let Amazon into your house? What happened to Apple doubling down on secrecy? Are you lining up for an iPhone X—and is it the ultimate form of Apple's smartphone?

episodes.title: 211: Don't Want People to See All My Trees
episodes.description: Machine learning for sensitive photos, our dalliances with other desktop platforms, whether anyone still needs real cameras, and the walled garden of voice assistants.

episodes.title: 210: Sweet, Sweet Caffeine
episodes.description: Tim Cook talks AR glasses, some thoughts on diversity and inclusion in tech, what we do for ergonomics, and how we cope with social media in our everyday life.

episodes.title: 209: Fancy Carbs
episodes.description: Google's notch-less Pixel design vs. the iPhone X, justification for Apple TV's high price (or lack thereof), our can't-live-with-'em-can't-live-without-'em technology choices, and iOS 11's Notes app.

episodes.title: 208: Even Mantis Shrimps Can't See It
episodes.description: Resurrected Apple television arguments, explaining quantum computing, Apple's Bing-for-Google swap, and our favorite games that iOS 11 leaves by the wayside.

episodes.title: 207: The 'C' Stands for Caveman
episodes.description: iPhone buying decisions, anonymous apps, our opinion on augmented reality, and the biggest missing features from our favorite tech products.

episodes.title: 206: The Safari Bandwagon
episodes.description: Apple's huge smartphone line-up, our most anticipated High Sierra features, how we feel about wireless charging our iPhones, and how much is too much to pay for a smartphone?

episodes.title: 205: Candy-Coated Vegetables
episodes.description: Paying attention to what apps ask for, our biggest speculation blunders, Apple event anticipation, and what type of content we take when we go offline.

episodes.title: 204: I'm Having an Existential Crisis Over Here
episodes.description: What we'd like to see on a new Apple TV (if not 4K/HDR), whether or not we've cut the cord, our thoughts on Alexa and Cortana becoming besties, and what it takes for Apple to feature your photo on Instagram.

episodes.title: 203: Spacetastic
episodes.description: How our feelings have changed (or not) on HomePod, the security risks of robots, dealing with online backup services, and whether iOS releases should have nicknames.

episodes.title: 202: Explode a Knee
episodes.description: Alternative messaging apps, rumors of an LTE Apple Watch, our primary news sources, and the surprising apps that we use on our phones.

episodes.title: 201: We Hate Boredom but Don't Like Change
episodes.description: Social media routines, what print-focused media companies are doing wrong and right in their transition to the digital age, apps we want on iPad, and iPhone rumors and the stress they cause.

episodes.title: 200: Inbox Infinite
episodes.description: Will voice-based interfaces really catch on, what we think of the "leaked" iPhone 8 icon, does anybody really want a smart watch, and what we use to keep ourselves organized.

episodes.title: 199: I Don't Really Want to Find My Friends
episodes.description: How our desks are set up, will Apple build more products in the U.S., Google's Find My Friends competitor, and advanced medical devices that work with our smartphones.

episodes.title: 198: Fire Bad, Trees Good
episodes.description: 3D Touch and Force Touch, Google Glass in factories, iMessage apps and stickers, and how social media has changed our news consumption.

episodes.title: 197: So Much of Your Life is a Lie
episodes.description: Net neutrality, brain-training games, wireless charging, and our camera-filled future.

episodes.title: 196: I'm Taking My Face Off the Internet
episodes.description: Backup strategies, how Amazon has changed our shopping habits, QR codes and NFC tags, and rumors of Touch ID's demise.

episodes.title: 195: Clearly You're Both Wrong
episodes.description: Working on laptops vs. iPads, having tech empathy, installing iOS 11 betas, and how Amazon acquiring Whole Foods could affect grocery delivery.

episodes.title: 194: Full-Time Icon Designer
episodes.description: The watchOS 4 features we'd hoped for, Lenovo's PC-as-a-Service push, new Live Photo improvements, and how we feel about leaks of unannounced Apple products.

episodes.title: 193: Just Say No to Cash
episodes.description: How we think Apple Pay will stack up against competing person-to-person payment services, our favorite conference cities, impressions of the Apple Pencil, and who should take over as Uber's CEO.

episodes.title: 192: This is Why I Left
episodes.description: It's WWDC week, so we talk Apple's HomePod, the new iMac Pro, iPad improvements, and what was missing from the keynote.

episodes.title: 191: So Many Dusty Shelves
episodes.description: The Essential Home, add-on camera lenses for smartphones, mobile camera apps, and our verdict on the Nintendo Switch.

episodes.title: 190: McGruff the Password Dog
episodes.description: Ikea's foray into smart home tech, tech disruption we'd like to see, what Android features we want on iOS and vice versa, and the tech story the masses need to know.

episodes.title: 189: Her Cuneiform is Top Notch
episodes.description: Apple Watch smart bands, old tech we'd resurrect, the fate of the iPad mini, and why more tech companies don't focus on accessibility.

episodes.title: 188: Also Called a Phone Call
episodes.description: Amazon's new Echo Show (it's not a podcast), the new Echo messaging and calling features, how we listen to our audio, and the importance of security updates.

episodes.title: 187: On the Phone I'm a Monster
episodes.description: The Microsoft's Surface Laptop as a MacBook Air alternative, addictive Internet technologies, Hulu's play for cord cutters, and our nerdy enthusiasms. Plus there's a momentous announcement at the very end of the episode!

episodes.title: 186: Project Me on a Hologram
episodes.description: Ride the Clockwise roller coaster as we discuss the breaking announcement of the Amazon Echo Look, deconstruct Uber's latest bad news, marvel at Samsung's record Galaxy S8 orders, and cower in fear at tech companies taking personal data and selling it to other tech companies.

episodes.title: 185: Add Things to Things
episodes.description: Facebook tackles VR, Nintendo's emulator shenanigans, moving the Touch ID sensor, and leaving ourselves digital reminders.

episodes.title: 184: My Hands Smell Delightful
episodes.description: Live from Ireland, it's travel tech we wish would die, embarrassing tech fads we've bought, Apple products we want to bring back from the dead, and dream features for Siri and Alexa.

episodes.title: 183: The Mystery Machine
episodes.description: This week we discuss our thoughts on Apple's professional Mac announcement, how often we replace our Apple devices, what tech we take with us on vacation, and which features we're surprised to see less tech-savvy folks use (or not).

episodes.title: 182: Sorry, My Brain Crashed
episodes.description: This week we freak out about tech failures, internet privacy, and brain interfaces, but also take a soothing break by proposing some new acquisitions for tech giants.

episodes.title: 181: A List of Things That Don't Happen
episodes.description: Reading it later, replacing Uber, finding significance in minor Apple updates, and subscribing to YouTube channels.

episodes.title: 180: Stargate Problem
episodes.description: Games we're playing, anticipating new iPads, video streaming and sharing, and greener grass on other platforms.

episodes.title: 179: So Many People Are Bad
episodes.description: Tech companies we try to avoid, the Internet of Home Spying, our personal finance choices, and barriers to better smart home tech.

episodes.title: 178: Artisanal Pickle
episodes.description: Lightning versus USB-C, the return of the Feature Phone, space tourism, and unlimited wireless data.

episodes.title: 177: Burn It Down and Start Over
episodes.description: Our favorite workspaces, fresh tech for the cornfield, the gender of voice assistants, and a Touch Bar check-in.

episodes.title: 176: Cool But Also Creepy
episodes.description: Wireless charging, voice assistants, bad Kickstarter projects, and stretching your brain technically.

episodes.title: 175: Same As It Ever Was
episodes.description: YouTube goes live, Twitter fights abuse (again), Apple TV gets a new manager, and your old photos get a little less real.

episodes.title: 174: Irrational Exuberance
episodes.description: This week's release of Apple's financial results prompts us to ponder the future of the iPad, iTunes, Apple's video strategy, and the wearables market.

episodes.title: 173: Old Tech Dies Hard
episodes.description: Apple makes surprising App Store changes, the Mac turns 33, the value of time tracking, and screens that turn orange when it gets dark.

episodes.title: 172: Serial iPhone Killer
episodes.description: The Nintendo Switch, Twitter security challenges, the death of Vine, and the changing face of Apple support.

episodes.title: 171: Built-In Babel Fish
episodes.description: This week we discuss how the iPhone has changed our lives, whether the Apple Watch has met our initial expectations, how we rely on product testing and recommendations, and a possible brain drain at Apple.

episodes.title: 170: The Internet of Garbage
episodes.description: We kick off 2017 by talking CES gadgets like a robot butler and a smart trash can, then move on to our feelings on AirPods and our resolutions for Apple in 2017.

episodes.title: 169: All the Great Dongles
episodes.description: In our final episode of 2016 we review the best and worst and dumbest and most life-changing things of the year, and then look ahead to 2017.

episodes.title: 168: Giant Pyramid of Coal
episodes.description: Mario vs. piracy, Mac desktops, a tech Naughty List, and last-minute gift ideas.

episodes.title: 167: Paper Form Wizard
episodes.description: How we estimate mobile-device battery life, the wisdom of delaying Apple's AirPods, apps for the Apple Pencil, and sharing-economy guilt.

episodes.title: 166: Walk-In Vending Machine
episodes.description: Amazon's high-tech convenience store, tech trends we just don't understand, gauging our home-tech paranoia threshold, and using our tech superpowers to give back.

episodes.title: 165: Orgy of Consumer Spending
episodes.description: The holidays (and holiday sales) are in full swing, but do we partake? We also consider detoxing from social media, ponder the contradictions of cord-cutting, and get a visit from a Mysterious Benefactor.

episodes.title: 164: Voiceovers and Aluminiums
episodes.description: Go-to travel gear, Apple's mysterious Mac and Wi-Fi strategies, and the future of Jony Ive.

episodes.title: 163: The Ultimate Dongle
episodes.description: This week we offer a panoply of adapters and horror stories about bad password etiquette, then discuss Apple's new self-publishing venture and the utility of pressure-sensitive computer interfaces.

episodes.title: 162: Privacy is a Feature
episodes.description: The future of laptop keyboards, whether VR can be good at anything beyond entertainment, the growing importance of encryption, and a watchOS 3 check-in.

episodes.title: 161: Emotional Life Preserver
episodes.description: Live from Ireland, we discuss Apple and the Mac, our tech passions, keyboards, and VR prospects.

episodes.title: 160: There's No Escape
episodes.description: Finding lost items via technology, Apple's Magic Toolbar, Microsoft's new playbook, and revisiting CarPlay.

episodes.title: 159: A Cow Episode
episodes.description: This week we rebrand Samsung, eat meat grown in a lab, watch the Apple Car make a U-turn, and change all our passwords.

episodes.title: 158: Business Carpeting Service
episodes.description: Amazon's Echo music subscription, the Internet of Things gets infected with malware, preferred methods of paying for software, and excitement for virtual and augmented reality.

episodes.title: 157: Plotting Together
episodes.description: Google's new stuff, including Google Home; Apple's new Spoken Editions of print articles; and imagining the Next Big Thing.

episodes.title: 156: Right, That's Still Going On!
episodes.description: Blocking spam calls, other uses for a Galaxy Note 7, the prospect (again) of Google-built phones, and Blackberry's body hits the floor.

episodes.title: 155: Old Slippery Six
episodes.description: When we trust and distrust the cloud with our files, features future smartphones should strive for, Google's launch of Allo, and unsung features of new smartphone toys.

episodes.title: 154: Others of Us Will Be Sad
episodes.description: iMessage apps, anticipated macOS Sierra features, iPhone pre-orders, and Swift Playgrounds.

episodes.title: 153: I Don't Swim
episodes.description: Breaking down Apple's media event, from iPhone to AirPods to dual cameras to Apple Watch Series 2.

episodes.title: 152: Dad, Play This
episodes.description: Sonos gets cozy with Amazon Echo, our many terabytes of cloud storage, the promise of AI software, and Aleen searches for a birthday present for her husband.

episodes.title: 151: Maybe They'll Update GarageBand
episodes.description: The value of music subscriptions, Bloomberg's weird Apple Watch story, old software we still cling to, and our personal beta-testing policies.

episodes.title: 150: Find My Enemies
episodes.description: Geolocating friends and family, the appeal of Chromebooks, using keyboards with tablets, and favorite Mac menu-bar items.

episodes.title: 149: Watching an Alien Sunset
episodes.description: Wired versus wireless headphones, No Man's Sky and the games of our dreams, hopes for iPad improvements, and the future of the enormous smartphone.

episodes.title: 148: Everything's a Remix
episodes.description: The ethics of copying in tech, buying an Apple car, a pox on Smart TVs, and the problem of Emoji fragmentation.

episodes.title: 147: It's All Zubats Around Here
episodes.description: The rise of biometrics, retail therapy to offset the end of the world, AR and Poke Mans, and Adobe's relationship with Apple.

episodes.title: 146: Marvel Has Killed Me
episodes.description: Reading comics digitally, smart home confusion, Twitter verification, and teaching programming.

episodes.title: 145: I’ve Always Wanted to Have a French Accent
episodes.description: Apple considers an app reality show, unsung app heroes, Pokémon Go, and embracing the cloud.

episodes.title: 144: Rock Music and Short Pants
episodes.description: Email policies, the threats of VR, two-factor authentication, and privacy versus convenience.

episodes.title: 143: A Whole New Watch
episodes.description: The prospects of a new Apple Watch, upgrading old hardware (or not), requiem for the Thunderbolt Display, and chatbots.

episodes.title: 142: Spare Device or No Dice
episodes.description: Robots analyzing photos, the real chances for VR success, smart home frustration, and the opening of beta season.

episodes.title: 141: Not Even in the Rotator
episodes.description: Live from San Francisco, we're joined by Relay FM founders Myke Hurley and Stephen Hackett to discuss all four platforms discussed during Apple's WWDC keynote.

episodes.title: 140: Check Under Your Seat
episodes.description: Technology giveaways, freshening up Apple Music, expanding Apple Pay, and iOS dream features.

episodes.title: 139: You've Got to Feed Those Chickens
episodes.description: Upgrading old hardware, the relevance of Amazon Prime Video, passing the tip jar for free stuff, and the peril and promise of wireless charging.

episodes.title: 138: You Know What You're Signing Up For
episodes.description: Siri API integrations, no Overwatch on Mac, Apple missing the AI wave, and the MacBook Pro's rumored OLED touchbar.

episodes.title: 137: You're All American
episodes.description: Google I/O keynote reaction! Google Home v. Amazon Echo, Google Assistant v. Siri, Allo and Duo, and Android Wear 2 v. Apple Watch.

episodes.title: 136: A Pox On Both Their Houses
episodes.description: Oracle versus Google in the rematch nobody wanted to see, strategies for buying a smartphone in a world without phone subsidies, Instagram's icon and our fears of change, and a revisiting of the new Apple TV app platform.

episodes.title: 135: Angst in Appleville
episodes.description: Potential Apple Music fixes, concerns about iPhone sales, the value of tech unitaskers, and the future of digital cameras.

episodes.title: 134: My Deepest Condolences 😢
episodes.description: The meaning of emoji, nerdy t-shirts, what Apple can learn from Apple Music, and a near-term wish list for Alexa and Siri.

episodes.title: 133: Talk Candidly About Ladies' Pants
episodes.description: People who are sad about the MacBook and iPhone SE, imagining an Apple Car, and embracing our cyborg futures.

episodes.title: 132: Person or Not
episodes.description: Facebook's chat-bot future, popular tech misconceptions, Apple Watch 2's killer features, and the strange case of AirPlay on Android.

episodes.title: 131: The Dream of the Early 2000s
episodes.description: Anticipating a new Kindle, conversations with robots, hanging out at Internet cafés, and living the iPad lifestyle.

episodes.title: 130: The Stephen Hackett Approach
episodes.description: What to do with old technology, the merits of phone cases, VR's impact on society, and our feelings about Microsoft.

episodes.title: 129: Flop Thunderdome
episodes.description: The FBI backs off, the iPad gets a name change, the iPhone gets a blast from the past, and we pick Apple's greatest flops.

episodes.title: 128: Non-Virtual Nausea
episodes.description: The appeal of Apple News (or lack thereof), how social media and forensics could have changed the O.J. Simpson trial, our favorite ways to mix devices and the real world, and technology hoarding habits.

episodes.title: 127: The Great Inbox in the Sky
episodes.description: The rise of the AIs, the appeal of premium smartphones, how we're reading books these days, and the death (or not) of email.

episodes.title: 126: Go into Space with Jerks
episodes.description: Choosing between convenience and security, our virtual-reality future, the viability of voice interfaces, and spending time in outer space.

episodes.title: 125: You're a Four Right Now
episodes.description: Apple's venture into public betas, worst-case Apple/FBI scenarios, stealing good Android phone features, and the ethics of rating people.

episodes.title: 124: Church of Beyoncé
episodes.description: Kanye pushes Tidal, Apple pushes back on the FBI, what we do with home videos, and the eternal Mac/iPad dichotomy.

episodes.title: 123: I Could Probably Live Without the Sandwich
episodes.description: Broken phone horror stories, talking to our computers, chronological Twitter order up gives on, and clicky keyboards.

episodes.title: 122:  It Always Comes Back to Robot Butlers
episodes.description: Streaming services we rely on, home automation we're proud of, Apple's rumored move toward exclusive video, and shiny happy customer service stories.

episodes.title: 121: Customer Sad
episodes.description: The chances for VR, Apple's best/worst quarter ever, iPad's continuing slump, and podcasts come to Apple TV.

episodes.title: 120: The Las Vegas of Weather
episodes.description: Things get a bit dark as we ponder a technological Sophie's Choice, prepare for our inevitable doom, and embrace terrible software, all before finally escaping to the paradise of the iPad.

episodes.title: 119: Freaking out the Neighbors
episodes.description: How we use cameras, the smartness of our houses, headphones we have loved, and tech news sources.

episodes.title: 118: Bright and Bushy Tailed
episodes.description: Our panel of people who aren't at CES this week discuss smartening home devices, the right age for a first iPhone, and 2016 tech resolutions.

episodes.title: 117: Sunset My Brain
episodes.description: Listener submitted topics look back at 2015 and ahead at new year's resolutions, tech in 2016, and the far future. Plus, the first Clockwise Secret Santa gift exchange.

episodes.title: 116: You Can't Fight City Hall
episodes.description: Apple's rumored TV service stalls, bulging iPhone battery cases, products that were bought and ruined, and the iOS map battle heats up.

episodes.title: 115: I Don't Believe in Unlimited
episodes.description: Holiday shopping, Cortana comes to iOS, the value of the headphone jack, and the rising cost of (grandfathered) unlimited iPhone data.

episodes.title: 114: That's So Canadian of You
episodes.description: Holiday tech support, the benefits and costs of social media, tech we're thankful for, and the market for professional iPad apps.

episodes.title: 113: A Bit of a Fatalist
episodes.description: iPad Pro size and productivity, a requiem for Rdio, and the Mac App Store goes boom.

episodes.title: 112: I'm Leaving the Internet Now
episodes.description: The iPad Pro arrives, the threat of Ransomware, Android gets Apple Music, and Apple TV week two.

episodes.title: 111: If You Wish upon a Heart
episodes.description: Apple TV apps and remotes, Twitter reaches for the stars and comes up with hearts, and yet more rumors about a new 4-inch iPhone.

episodes.title: 110: AirPlay Express
episodes.description: The post-post-PC era, Apple TV apps versus smartphones, Google gets into podcasting, and South By Southwest steps in it.

episodes.title: 109: Muggle Keyboard
episodes.description: Anticipating Apple TV, Google's new YouTube Red service, iOS stability and bug fixes, and a Magic Devices shopping list.

episodes.title: 108: Mysteriously Concealed Peas
episodes.description: Apple technology in need of some love, surviving Apple's high season, Apple's newest product announcements, and dumb tech trends.

episodes.title: 107: None of Them Do Everything
episodes.description: Dreaming of new Macs, favorite El Capitan features, Amazon bans Apple TV, and Microsoft puts on an Apple costume.

episodes.title: 106: Don't Go to the Tree
episodes.description: Faster in-flight Wi-Fi, Apple's loss of focus on iWork, Google's new stuff, and Elon Musk's mission to Mars.

episodes.title: 105: Opposite of Schadenfreude
episodes.description: Amazon's hardware line-up, Volkswagen cheats on a test, OS upgrade strategies, and evaluating watchOS 2.

episodes.title: 104: Mrs Weasley's Clock
episodes.description: The future of smartphone upgrades, Apple TV app dreams, upgrading to iOS 9 (or not), and thinking big about the iPad Pro.

episodes.title: 103: TV Sandwich
episodes.description: Live from San Francisco--seriously, this episode was recorded standing under some trees in Civic Center Plaza--we're reviewing the Sept. 9 Apple event! A new iPad pro! The new iPhone 6S and 6S Plus! An entirely different Apple TV! We've got the details.

episodes.title: 102: You Failed Them
episodes.description: Dreaming of Siri and Apple TV improvements, fearing an Apple-programmed video service, and dealing with being the IT manager for our friends and family.

episodes.title: 101: Maybe We Should Call AppleCare
episodes.description: Choosing a single device, calling for help, traveling with technology, and mourning Apple's One to One training.

episodes.title: 100: The Speed of Your Voice
episodes.description: An introspective, touchy-feely edition of Clockwise as we celebrate our 100th episode with special guest hosts and special guest guests.

episodes.title: 99: I Wear Amber Goggles at Night
episodes.description: Alphabetizing Google, blocking web ads, navigating with map apps, and improving iOS.

episodes.title: 98: Robot-Kicking Problem
episodes.description: Apple's cell service plans (or lack thereof), HitchBot's demise, Windows 10's privacy snafu, and the end of removable batteries and SD cards in phones.

episodes.title: 97: Given Phones and Sent into the World
episodes.description: T-Mobile's crazy iPhone deal, the arrival of Windows 10, when advertisements are actually worth seeing, and buying a kid a Kindle.

episodes.title: 96: Faraday Cave
episodes.description: Special dystopian future edition! We envision the Apple of 2020, fear ever getting in a car again after the latest car hack, complain about autocorrect, and take the measure of the need for Apple Watch apps.

episodes.title: 95: The Only iPod Touch Fangirl
episodes.description: Comcast's streaming TV plan, Reddit's supernova of problems, the promise of smaller iPhones, and a shining iBeacon of hope.

episodes.title: 94: Defend the Indefensible
episodes.description: Apple's role as Safari steward, the best Apple hardware ever, anticipating a new iPod, and the next big thing for smartphone technology.

episodes.title: 93: Double Down on Corn
episodes.description: Apple unleashes the executives, paying attention to accessibility, dream of a Mac Nano, and what's the deal with Amazon hardware?

episodes.title: 92: Betas are for Chumps
episodes.description: Apple Music's future prospects, whether anyone should use OS betas, the reality of iPad productivity features actually being used, and the merits of maintenance OS upgrades.

episodes.title: 91: Next to Compass
episodes.description: Live from San Francisco! An update for the Apple Watch, the iPad gets some respect, the power of preinstalled apps, and Apple's Phil Schiller goes on a podcast.

episodes.title: 90: Cord Nevers
episodes.description: Renaming the iPhone, dreams of cord-cutting nirvana, WWDC wishcasting, and Tim Cook's EPIC rant.

episodes.title: 89: A Bunch of Dopes
episodes.description: Quick reactions to the Google I/O keynote, including Google Photos, a focus on bug fixes, contextual machine intelligence, and searching for the next billion Internet users.

episodes.title: 88: A Hot Mess
episodes.description: We predict this episode is about Google I/O predictions,  Apple TV WWDC predictions, our predictions about the future of human interface design, and the predictions we've made that failed spectacularly.

episodes.title: 87: Creeped Out By Robots
episodes.description: How we use product reviews, mediocre Apple Watch apps, self-driving cars, and Facebook's Instant Articles.

episodes.title: 86: Buzzing My Wrist
episodes.description: The Apple TV might get a new remote control, Apple Watch faces and utility, and how we're making our homes into smart homes (or not).

episodes.title: 85: Squeals of Joy and Pain
episodes.description: Apple Watch first impressions, sympathy for Microsoft, iPad sales on the wane, and Dropbox gets social-ish.

episodes.title: 84: The Amazon Echosystem
episodes.description: Amazon Echo and intelligent assistants, Apple's declining 'onboarding' experience, the furor over Twitter's direct message changes, and what other sensors we'd like to see on the Apple Watch.

episodes.title: 83: Giant Pyramid
episodes.description: Comparing Apple Watch purchases, WWDC expectations, the future of Beats Music, and a week with Photos for Mac.

episodes.title: 82: Stunt Queuing
episodes.description: No more sleeping outside of Apple stores, the future of Periscope, whether Star Wars on iTunes matters, and our review of the early Apple Watch reviews.

episodes.title: 81: Little Tiny Terrycloth Robes
episodes.description: Live from Ireland: Books about Apple, Tim Cook's pronouncements, terrible hotel wi-fi, and why we go to conferences.

episodes.title: 80: We're All Dying Slowly
episodes.description: Excitement over a new Apple TV box, what wearables may come, whether today's wearables incur health risks, and what service or piece of software we first paid for.

episodes.title: 79: The Next Free Noms
episodes.description: Apple TV and the future of cord cutting, the risky world of iOS public betas, how we use desktops and laptops, and our Austin correspondent provides us with facts about South By Southwest.

episodes.title: 78: MacBook Nothing
episodes.description: Apple Watch value and pricing, MacBook sacrifices, Apple TV deals, and Uber's latest crisis.

episodes.title: 77: A Computer for Ants
episodes.description: Predicting the Apple Watch and hoping for a Retina MacBook air, encryption and paranoia, and the latest in curved screens.

episodes.title: 76: The Darkness
episodes.description: What's attached to our TVs, the prospects for an Apple stylus, Kickstarter as a store, and if the future of artificial intelligence threatens all humanity or is just another pipe dream.

episodes.title: 75: Aluminum Foil Everything
episodes.description: The Apple Car can't be real, right? Plus NSA and Samsung TV spying and Apple's greatest threats.
Organizing your digital photos, managing your money, third-party iOS keyboards, and our desert-island games and podcasts. Plus some emojis.

episodes.title: 73: I Prefer My Cars With Backdoors
episodes.description: Converting paper books to ebooks, a requiem for The Shack, Apple's worst product, and self-driving Ubers.

episodes.title: 72: Robot Butler
episodes.description: Apple's huge quarterly results, the psychology of Kickstarter, Microsoft's holograms, and technology that cures life's annoyances.

episodes.title: 71: ToasterPen
episodes.description: Wireless charging, the future of hybrid devices, getting stuck in a tech rut, and pondering the humble stylus.

episodes.title: 70: Little Crab Hands
episodes.description: Apple's endless quest for thinner and lighter devices, Faux Apple Watches at CES and the rise of Apple Watch fever, the final destination of the iPod touch, and an era ends at the iTunes Store.

episodes.title: 69: Quantum Dots and Kooky Segways
episodes.description: 12-inch MacBook rumors, why tech hipsters hate on Facebook, selling you a new TV, and the relevance of CES.

episodes.title: 68: Genuine Frontier Gibberish
episodes.description: In this plus-sized year-end edition, Philip Michaels returns to steal the show from Dan and Jason. Topics include the top tech news of 2014, press apologies, dead technology, job security, crisis management, app regrets, top 2014 tech, anticipation, app rejection, and tech talk shows.

episodes.title: 67: Disapproving Record Clerk
episodes.description: Excitement for 2015 technology, Apple OS features we don't use, a requiem for old media, and the Sony leaks.

episodes.title: 66: Driving Through Magic
episodes.description: Apple's App Store rejections, early video game memories, Siri on the desktop, and why we should care about Net Neutrality.

episodes.title: 65: The Slovenian Perspective
episodes.description: Automating boring tasks, holiday shopping lists, favorite subscription services, and buying cheap tech accessories.

episodes.title: 64: Disposable Electric Car
episodes.description: Our backup strategies, subscription services for apps, the death of the tablet, and electric cars.

episodes.title: 63: Uber, What's Up With It?
episodes.description: Apple's future plans for Beats, Uber everything awful somebody do something, Apple Watch as seen from a distance, and the future of encryption.

episodes.title: 62: Light at the End of the Pipe
episodes.description: Workplace ergonomics, Microsoft's entrance into wearable tech, the eternal virtual reality pipe dream, and the Uncanny Valley of personal digital assistants.

episodes.title: 61: Chancellor of Burberry
episodes.description: Taking stock of iCloud Drive, the Apple Watch gets "delayed," Christian Bale bails, and singing the praises of old technology. With guests John Moltz and Dan Frakes.

episodes.title: 60: Spite Corporation
episodes.description: How we read e-books, the future prospects of the Apple SIM, Apple Pay versus CurrentC, and the (now resolved?) PCalc widget controversy. With guests Christina Warren and Serenity Caldwell.

episodes.title: 59: Everything's Weird
episodes.description: Flat iPad sales, accelerating Apple OS updates, Retina displays on the desktop, and room for improvement at the Apple Store. With guests Jessie Char and Paul Kafasis.

episodes.title: 58: All My Money Is Gone
episodes.description: Live from Montreal: Expectations of Yosemite, dreaming of Macs with color selections, the Mac App Store, iOS 8, and keeping up with the Cardassians. With special Canadian guests Rene Ritchie and Georgia Dow.

episodes.title: 57: Piegate
episodes.description: Our dreams of new iPads, Google's responsibility to patrol the Internet, a hail of technology scandals, and iOS 8's slow adoption rate. And be sure to leave room for pie!

episodes.title: 56: Niche of Awesomeness
episodes.description: The prospects for Apple Pay, Apple and software quality, adapting apps to the iPhone 6 Plus, and our nostalgia for unloved old tech.

episodes.title: 55: Extreme Physical Butt Force
episodes.description: Our favorite iOS 8 apps, loving and hating third-party keyboards, the first week with new iPhones (except for Lex), and Dan explains how many different objects can be bent if you put your mind to it. With guests Lex Friedman and Rene Ritchie.

episodes.title: 54: Government in Exile
episodes.description: We've all left IDG but we're still here! This week we talk iPhone 6, compare the 6 to the 6 Plus, ponder an overabundance of apps, and talk about our favorite iOS 8 features. With guests Dan Frakes and Philip Michaels!

episodes.title: 0: Tamagotchi Plays You
episodes.description: In this test episode of Clockwise, we discuss Prism, the ebook trial, home audio, and wearables.
